flashcards.front: Working class in late 19th century India? (Part 1/2)
flashcards.back: Late 19th century saw rise of modern industry in India, particularly in coal, cotton, and jute, forming backbone of Indian working class.

flashcards.front: Working class in late 19th century India? (Part 2/2)
flashcards.back: Labourers, factory workers, and miners faced harsh exploitation, with poor wages, long hours, and unsafe conditions, while their struggle was intertwined with fight for independence

mcq.question: Railway Minute introduced in?
mcq.explanation: Railway Minute of 1853 introduced machinery, leading to development of railways, coal, cotton, jute, and tea industries.

mcq.question: First Cotton Mill in India?
mcq.explanation: First Cotton Mill: Bombay, 1854; First jute mill: Calcutta, 1855.

mcq.question: Narayan Meghajee Lokhande (1880) founded (UPSC 2018)?
options: Deenbandhu newspaper and Bombay Mill and Millhands Association
mcq.explanation: Narayan Meghajee Lokhande (1880) played pivotal role in founding Deenbandhu newspaper and establishing Bombay Mill and Millhands Association (UPSC 2018).

mcq.question: Great Indian Peninsular Railways Strike (1899) received support from?
mcq.explanation: Great Indian Peninsular Railways Strike (1899) received strong support from nationalist newspapers like Tilak's Kesari and Maharatta.

mcq.question: Factory Act of 1881 (UPSC 2017) - maximum working hours for children?
mcq.explanation: Factory Act of 1881 set maximum working hours at 11 hours/day for children (UPSC 2017).

mcq.question: Factory Act of 1881 - minimum age for children to work?
mcq.explanation: Factory Act of 1881 prohibited employment of children under 7 years and raised minimum age for children to work to 12 years.

mcq.question: Factory Act of 1881 - rest period between shifts?
mcq.explanation: Factory Act of 1881 mandated 13-hour rest period between shifts for women and children.

mcq.question: Factory Act of 1891 - maximum working hours for children?
mcq.explanation: Factory Act of 1891 reduced maximum working hours for children to 7 hours a day.

mcq.question: Factory Act of 1891 - minimum working age for children?
mcq.explanation: Factory Act of 1891 raised minimum working age to 9 and maximum to 14 years.

mcq.question: Factory Act of 1891 innovation?
options: Banned night work for children and mandated overtime wages
mcq.explanation: Factory Act of 1891 banned employment of children in factories at night to protect their health and mandated overtime compensation.

mcq.question: Factory Acts for Jute Industry years?
mcq.explanation: Factory Acts for Jute Industry (1909 & 1911) focused on regulating working hours and improving safety standards in jute mills.
